alert.note: Alert for Cochise (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 27 at 2:27AM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 AM MST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following county, Cochise. * WHEN...Until 415 AM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 227 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25-0.75 of an inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bisbee, Hereford, Naco and Palominas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
